metadata.comments: This playbook will put VM in ISOLATE state which will deny all inbound and outbound connections and shutdown the VM
metadata.author: Nathan Swift

metadata.description: Enter the sender's email address. Make sure to use an account which can authorize the API connection after deploying this automation artifact.

Create_Isolate_NSG.description: Create a Azure NSG with deny all and a allow on OS management port, security personnel still needs to change rule priority to below 1000 to connect from Azure Bastion Host

Create_Resource_Group_for_Isolate_NSG.description: Create a Resource Group for the NSG, PIP, and Azure Bastion Host. This way once the forenscis are completed and VM moved back to the proper Subnet you can delete the extra resources if desired

HTTP_-_Get_Azure_VM.description: Obtain information on the Azure VM

HTTP_-_Get_VM_Nic.description: Obtain VM NIC level details, does the NIC have a PIP, a NSG attached to it, what subnet is it in.

Initialize_GUID_for_resource_naming.description: new GUID geenrated for RG and NSG, PIP, and Azure Bastion Host that will be created

Initialize_Resource_Group_Name.description: this variable will be used to generate a RG name and will be passed in several calls to create PIP, NSG, and Azure Bastion Host

Parse_JSON_3.description: Parse the Azure VM information for OS Disk Type

body.Body:
Azure Security Center has discovered a potential security threat in your environment and has isolated your Azure VM. Details below:

Alert name: @{triggerBody()?['AlertDisplayName']}

Attacked resource: @{triggerBody()?['CompromisedEntity']}

Alert severity: @{triggerBody()?['Severity']}

Detection time: @{triggerBody()?['TimeGenerated']}

Description: @{triggerBody()?['Description']}

Detected by: @{triggerBody()?['VendorName']}

Alert ID: @{triggerBody()?['SystemAlertId']}

Resource identifiers: @{body('Parse_JSON_3')?['id']}

Link to view alert in Azure Security Center: @{triggerBody()?['AlertUri']}
body.Subject: Azure Security Center has isolated a Azure VM due to a potential security threat in your environment

Update_Nic_with_Isolate_NSG.description: Move the Azure VM to a the ISOLATE Subnet that has a NSG applied, VM restarts dropping any persistent connections

initialize_NSG.description: Set variable with the newly created NSG's Azure Resource ID to be used later.
